A crudely - I mean - beautifully drawn map of your home. You made this to give to the architect in charge of making houses for this development. She took it with some incredulity and pity and said she’d do the best she could. You’ve carried it around in your wallet ever since you got it back.
Your beige connection to civilization is looking awfully inadequate right now. You know there is a mostly empty address book in a drawer in the table the phone sits upon.

This is where you push food into your mouth, sometimes after cooking it, often before. Stains and spills dot the floor, walls, and surfaces. At the back of the room is a counter where you usually prepare your food. On it rests a toaster, a blender, and a knife block. Standard kitchen appliances fill the room, like your refrigerator, sink, and a stovetop/oven. There is a door and staircase leading to the basement and a door to the backyard.

A gas can with a little spare gas for your car. You only used it once; that time that you put off an empty tank warning and couldn’t get the car to move out of the driveway for an emergency ice cream run. You refilled it after that, so it should be ready to go.
state.get: You’re lugging around this can now.

state.description: A gas can with a little spare gas for your car. You only used it once; that time that you put off an empty tank warning and couldn’t get the car to move out of the driveway for an emergency ice cream run. You refilled it after that, so it should be ready to go.

It’s ammonia. A cleaning solution for the toughest stains. Goes without saying that it hasn’t been touched. You notice a triangular warning label and a blurb explaining that this substance is not to be mixed with bleach as it will create a deadly gas.
state.get: You slide the bottle into your pocket.

state.description: It’s ammonia. A cleaning solution for the toughest stains. Goes without saying that it hasn’t been touched. You notice a triangular warning label and a blurb explaining that this substance is not to be mixed with bleach as it will create a deadly gas.
With the tools you have here, and maybe some things from around the house, you might be able to fashion yourself some means of dispatching the killer. Just need to get some ideas on what to make.

It’s a pinata you had made of your head for your birthday years ago, but it remained here, unused. The colors and its vague resemblance to yourself just look eerie down here. Being stalked by a murderer doesn’t help matters.
state.get: You lift the head and support it under your right arm.

state.description: You feel a bit silly carrying it around but you might be able to use it if you need a stand-in for your head.

state.description: It's a secret.

How this room evaded your notice astounds and frightens you. How long has this been here? Along one wall there hangs a series of clean suits, and two of the three are stained dark red with layers of old blood. There is a table and sink of the type for operations. On the wall, you see a map. To your right, there is a computer on a desk. The staircase leads back up to the fireplace entrance which you came from.

The passage leading from the other side of your fireplace is closed tightly.
A large sink. Undoubtedly - whoever this man is - he has been using this sink to wash away evidence of whatever foul deeds he commits in this room.
A spectacle of graphics and sound. You feel a twinge of jealousy that a computer like this was down here the entire time while you do not have one. It's currently off.
You look at the glowing screen and see only one file: "Journal.txt"

A staircase leading back up to living room. At the top, the false wall in the fireplace stands firmly in the way.
Isn’t that...Teddy? It so is. You lost him under your bed when you were like, 4. Same dirt stains, same child scrawl in his tag.
state.get: You snag it. Teddy is back, baby.

state.description: It's your old bear, Teddy.

You click the file and begin to read:[DOUBLENEWLINE]Teddy has begun to speak to me. At first it was just a whisper, but it has grown clearer and clearer with each passing day. He wants me to push further. He likes to watch what I do in here. I relish his company. I would do anything for him. I would love to take him with me when I visit the neighbors but I cannot risk injury to him. If anything were to happen to him, I don’t know what I would do.
A map hanging on the wall of what appears to be your neighborhood. Several of the houses have red "X"s on them...ominous.
state.get: Not much point in touching it right now, though you make a mental note that detectives should definitely see this if you make it out of this alive.

state.description: This is your humble backyard. It’s too dark to see the splendor of your dead grass and barren flowerbeds...at least you have a shed.

Rusted, crusted, but still well constructed. You might be able to trap the intruder in there with this, if you could find a way to lure him in.
state.get: You decide not to mess with the lock until you can get the killer into the shed.

state.description: Hey, it doesn't look so bad from the outside! At least when it's dark out, that is.

state.description: A rickety wooden fence encircles your whole back yard. You were too lazy to buy a paintbrush when you painted it, so the paint is blotchy and peeling.

state.description: THE SHED
This is probably the first time you’ve been in here in over a year. By the dim light of your flashlight, you see a folded tarp, a rake, a hose, and a rather forlorn looking bike.
Your small shed houses the beginnings of a dummy of yourself to lure in the killer. By the dim light of your flashlight, you see a folded tarp, a rake, a hose, and a rather forlorn looking bike.
You have made your shed into a trap. In the center of the shack stands a dummy of yourself, complete with whimpering action! Better hide now so you can spring the trap.

A battered old bike. Not much you can do with this thing, not after the accident that rendered it useless and gave you several nasty bruises. Just kidding, you left it in the street once and it got mashed by a car.
state.get: This thing is much too beat up to try and use now. Besides, what would you do with it - pedal away from the killer?

state.description: checkitem
state.get: You decide not to move this from here since it would be useless anywhere else, not to mention impossibly unwieldy.

state.description: A blue tarp for yard work and exterior painting. You notice that it’s a similar color to your shirt.
state.get: This thing crinkles and makes a ton of noise when you move it, so you decide you shouldn’t carry it around through the house. You might find some use for it in here though.

state.description: It's part of the dummy now.

You push open the front door, hoping that something other than what’s about to happen will happen to you. But it doesn’t. The man draws a knife from a pocket in the cleansuit and raises it through the air in one movement. You see a flash of something silver, a flash of something red, and you pass out.[DOUBLENEWLINE]Press [ENTER] to restart.

The phone rings just once before a gruff, loud voice barks “Paulie’s Pizza, whaddya want?” “Paulie, it’s me, I need help!”, you hurriedly exclaim. Paulie, recognizing your voice immediately, says, “Oh, it’s you. Your usual will be there in 30 minutes,” before hanging up. Great! Maybe now you can die with a full stomach at least.
You hear the dial tone, then suddenly, nothing.. That’s...not a good thing to have happen right now...

The phone rings once. Then twice. Then again. “Hello,” you hear an aged, lethargic voice say. “Ms. Jones! Please,” you say, before someone cuts you off. “You’ve reached the voice mailbox of Ms. Dorothy Bringnette Widget-Jones. If this is an emergency, you can reach me at..” Jesus fucking Christ this lady. “...8737. Thank you very much, and have a nice day.” “Ms. Jones,” you say frantically into the receiver, “if you get this message, please call the police. Someone’s trying to kill me!” You stop, realize the futility, and hang up.
When the line connects, all that can be heard is a single, unbroken, bloodcurdling scream. Man, you can always count on Phil.

The phone rings once or twice and a curt woman answers, “9-1-1, what’s your emergency?” You quickly explain that a maniac is trying to break into your home and murder you. The operator is taken aback for a moment, but calmly tells you, “Remain in your home, officers will be there in 20 minutes.”
“Hello, you’ve reached Vangelis,” says an answering machine, “please leave a message.” Also a monster springs from the phone, killing you instantly.[DOUBLENEWLINE]Press [ENTER] to try again.

You know it’s not illegal to clean up every once in awhile, right? Anyway, it’s a big linoleum countertop. On it is a knife block.
Where some of your most impressive water boiling has taken place. There is a lighter on top.
Where some of your most impressive water boiling has taken place.
Your shower. You suppose this might be a spot you could hide in.
The shower curtain is closed. You suppose this might be a spot you could hide in.
Well, it might fool a crow.
Now we’re cookin’. What a... handsome chap.
An empty fireplace with a stone back and wood frame. To it’s left, there is bottle of lighter fluid, and above the mantle there is a painting.
An empty fireplace with a stone back and wood frame. Above the mantle there is a painting.
The back of the fireplace has opened to reveal a staircase leading downwards. To the left of the opening is a bottle of lighter fluid.
The back of the fireplace has opened to reveal a staircase leading downwards.
There is a small table beside your bed with a drawer. On it, rests a lamp and a tape recorder.

There is a small table beside your bed with a drawer. On it, rests a lamp.
A metal table covered in various surgical tools and items. Specifically, a scalpel, a pair of scissors, and a spoon.

A metal table with a scalpel on it.
A metal table with a spoon on it.
A metal table with a pair of scissors on it.
A metal table.
A window! From here you can see...not much. It’s dark. You can just make out your mailbox at the end of your front lawn. There appears to be someone standing at the door...

A window! From here you can see...not much. It’s dark. You can just make out your mailbox at the end of your front lawn.
Peering out your window, you see the pizza delivery man waiting outside your front door. Behind him, on the street, rests his scooter.
Peering out your window, you see the pizza delivery man waiting outside your front door. Behind him, on the street, rests his scooter.
Out of your window you see a police car parked on the street in front of your house. You can’t quite tell from this distance, but it appears empty.
Out of your window you see a police car parked on the street in front of your house. You can’t quite tell from this distance, but it appears empty.
Peering out your window, you see the red polo and khaki shorts that were your last hope. You could scream out to him, but you’d probably give yourself away.
Peering out your window, you see the red polo and khaki shorts that were your last hope. You could scream out to him, but you’d probably give yourself away.

With a jolt of panic, you see a tall man in a cleansuit, standing motionless on the other side of the door. His face is utterly impassive, and his eyes are fixed forward in front of him. In his left hand, you can just make out the top of a suitcase. You experience an impulse to bar the door and run.
You can make out a tiny bit of your front porch, but anything else is shrouded by darkness.
You see the pizza delivery man’s warped image through the peephole.
A police car is perceptible through the distorted darkness.
Out of the peephole, you see the back of the pizza man - he must be leaving!

After the two of you recover from the strangeness of the ordeal, the pizza box catches your eye from the floor. All the commotion sure did work up an appetite. You and the delivery man, whose name you find out is Randal, decide to share the pizza in celebration.
The jaws of the makeshift bear trap clamp down on his leg with surprising force, driving the blades deep into his leg. That was one damn good toaster; it’s bravery will not be forgotten.

The killer collapses at the bottom of the stairs, and does not stir. For a moment it appears as though you are safe. You slowly emerge from your hiding spot and edge towards his body but - surprise! He twitches. You start to make a break for the stairs but the killer is still too quick and grabs you by the leg. You turn your head back to see that the man has drawn a gun. Moments later, you are full of lead.
He falters before the bucket, as the first of the toxic fumes reaches his lungs. Coughing and spluttering, the killer attempts to flee but slips, falling down further.

The killer collapses at the bottom of the stairs, and does not stir. For a moment it appears as though you are safe. You slowly emerge from your hiding spot and edge towards his body but - surprise! He twitches. You start to make a break for the stairs but the killer is still too quick and grabs you by the leg. You turn your head back to see that the man has drawn a gun. Moments later, you are full of lead.

Near the bottom of the stairs, the killers foot connects at last with the trigger mechanism for your fire bomb. You know a second of blinding light and thunderous noise before the world resolves itself in flames. The killer flails uncontrollably in an attempt to remove the volatile mixture you created, which sputters and cracks all the more.

The boot of his cleansuit collides with your fecal subterfuge. It slips, causing the figure to topple and slam violently into the next step.

His head smacks sickeningly against each stair as he tumbles down the remaining flight. At the bottom of the stairs, his head lolls horribly on his limp frame one last time before he collapses into a bloody heap on the basement’s concrete floor.[DOUBLENEWLINE]You sure are going to have a lot of explaining to do to, but you did it.

You tell the killer to keep his distance as you shuffle past him and back your way up the staircase and through the now-open fireplace. You never take your eyes off of him, and he stares right back. When you reach the living room, you wrench open the front door, drop the teddy bear, and make a run for it. As you look back, to make sure you aren’t being followed, you see the silhouette of Teddy in the open front doorway, illuminated by the light from the living room.
Congratulations! You won!
You decide that you want to get out of here, but you don’t want to let the killer out of your sight. So, you demand that he return through the fireplace entrance and you follow behind.

Once you are both in the living room, you hear a soft knocking at the front door. You turn to look, and, in the moment of your distraction, the killer makes a break for the front door and yanks it open. On the other side is the pizza delivery guy holding the pizza you ordered. The stranger, having produced a knife, attempts to grapple with the delivery guy. The delivery guy clocks the stranger several times before he falls unconscious, taking care to keep your pizza balanced in one hand the entire time.
You thank the pizza guy for his help, and the two of you share the pizza and discuss the surreal events of the night.[DOUBLENEWLINE]Congratulations! You won!
You demand that the killer ascend the staircase as you follow behind, hoping that the police have arrived.

To your relief, you see the flashing red and blue lights of the squad car through your window when you both arrive in the living room. With no more options, the man in the cleansuit allows himself to be apprehended by the police. You are safe now, but you aren’t sure how safe you will feel while that lair you discovered remains behind your fireplace.[DOUBLENEWLINE]Congratulations! You won!
GAME OVER
You DIED! Press [ENTER] to try again.

Noxious fumes begin rising out of the bucket at once. You cough and recoil from the workbench, but it’s too late. You start to feel light-headed and soon are collapsed on the ground, losing consciousness. Looks like you did the killer’s work for him, nice.

Just as you feel yourself starting to drift off into a deep sleep, you think you might hear footsteps nearby. Before you can jump out from under the covers, a knife plunges through the cloth and into your body. At least you won’t have any more bad dreams.
